ticket.title: Make it possible to install plugins with Bazaar
ticket.original-body:
This patch makes it possible to install plugins directly from Bazaar branches, just like it's currently possible to install from Git and Subversion repositories.
script/plugin install bzr://example.com/acts_as_profitable
I haven't found a way to easily do unit tests against the implementation, and it doesn't seem that there exists any for neither the Git nor Subversion implementations. If you have any pointers or advise on this, I'd be more than happy to cover this patch with tests.

This patch makes it possible to install plugins directly from Bazaar branches, just like it's currently possible to install from Git and Subversion repositories.
script/plugin install bzr://example.com/acts_as_profitable
I haven't found a way to easily do unit tests against the implementation, and it doesn't seem like there exists any for neither the Git nor Subversion handlers. If you have any pointers or advise on this, I'd be more than happy to cover this patch with tests.
version.body-html:
This patch makes it possible to install plugins directly from Bazaar branches, just like it's currently possible to install from Git and Subversion repositories.

script/plugin install bzr://example.com/acts_as_profitable

I haven't found a way to easily do unit tests against the implementation, and it doesn't seem like there exists any for neither the Git nor Subversion handlers. If you have any pointers or advise on this, I'd be more than happy to cover this patch with tests.
version.title: Make it possible to install plugins with Bazaar
Make it possible to install plugins with Bazaar

version.body: Not really interested in this. People should just put the plugin inside vendor/plugins. Or even better, use gem plugins :)
version.body-html: Not really interested in this. People should just put the plugin inside vendor/plugins. Or even better, use gem plugins :)
version.title: Make it possible to install plugins with Bazaar

version.body:
We're working on another way to implement this.
Take a look at the 2 following threads :
http://rails.lighthouseapp.com/projects/8994/tickets/1284-add-hg-mercurial-support-to-scriptplugin
http://rails.lighthouseapp.com/projects/8994-ruby-on-rails/tickets/1436-an-extensible-api-for-plugin-management
But you're right, gem plugins are very handy.
